sentences.en: A new constitution was promulgated last month.
sentences.cn: 上个月颁布了一部新宪法。

sentences.en: All the governments promulgate related laws and regulations and wage special striking actions every year.
sentences.cn: 出台相关法律法规,每年开展专项行动.

sentences.en: Article 34 The Ministry Finance shall promulgate regulations governing the books of account and documentary evidence.
sentences.cn: 第34条(会计帐簿凭证管理办法之订定)营业人会计帐簿凭证之管理办法,由财政部定之.

sentences.en: As for college library, it is important to uphold right humane notion and promulgate its spirit.
sentences.cn: 对于图书馆来说, 确立正确的人文理念、展示传播人文精神非常重要.

sentences.en: Our group especially promulgate the most novel production with modern design elements for you in 2007.
sentences.cn: 我们的开发团队特为您发布2007年最高档新颖数码相框外壳前板.

sentences.en: The client may just operate the web page to promulgate information in foregrounding.
sentences.cn: 用户在前端只需通过简单的网页操作,就可发布信息.

sentences.en: The school shall erect regulations to implement gender equity education, and promulgate them.
sentences.cn: 学校应订定性别平等教育实施规定, 并公告周知.

sentences.en: The school shall prescribe and promulgate prevention and handling regulations for the aforesaid regulations.
sentences.cn: 学校应依前项准则订定防治规定,并公告周知.

sentences.en: The shipping industry promulgated a voluntary code.
sentences.cn: 航运业对自律守则进行了宣传。

sentences.en: To promulgate the belief that marketing is something that only salespeople do is exceedingly dangerous.
sentences.cn: 散布“营销只是销售人员的事情”这一信念是非常危险的.

sentences.en: We may find several from the Holy Bible to promulgate this truth the place.
sentences.cn: 我们可以从圣经中找到好几处揭示这一道理的地方.

trans.tran_cn: 发布, 公布, 传播
trans.tran_en: to spread an idea or belief to as many people as possible

trans.tran_cn: 宣扬（某事物），传播，公布，颁布（法令、新法律等）
